definition: to fight as a guerilla/(fig.) to live or eat at no fixed place
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: When Japan captured Peiping, Kao led his gendarmes into the countryside to fight a guerrilla war.
sentences.chinese: 日本侵入北平后，他带领他的警察到农村打游击。

sentences.english: After the failure of the coup many of the rebels took to the hills and became guerillas .
sentences.chinese: 政变失败后，许多反叛的人上山打游击去了。

sentences.english: He had never held such a fine weapon, not even in those days of guerrilla warfare thirty years before.
sentences.chinese: 货三十多年前他打游击时，也没拿到过这样的枪。

definition: to lie in wait/to ambush/to conceal sth
lit. straggling and disbanded soldiers (idiom); fig. disorganized uncoordinated action
to fortify defenses and raze the fields (idiom); to leave nothing for the invader/scorched earth policy
loose and disorganized soldiers/stragglers/fig. a loner
to pursue and kill/to wipe out
to break up the whole into pieces (idiom); dealing with things one by one/divide and conquer
to fight a battle/to go to war
